item.title: Compyl Raises $12 Million for GRC Platform
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Compyl has raised $12 million in a Series A funding round that will be invested in go-to-market initiatives, hirings, and GRC platform expansion.

The post Compyl Raises $12 Million for GRC Platform appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Ramnit Malware Infections Spike in OT as Evidence Suggests ICS Shift
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Industrial giant Honeywell has published its 2025 Cybersecurity Threat Report with information on the latest trends.

The post Ramnit Malware Infections Spike in OT as Evidence Suggests ICS Shift appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Webinar Today: Redefining Vulnerability Management With Exposure Validation
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Learn why your security controls matter more than theoretical risk scores and how exposure validation helps slash massive patch lists down to the few vulnerabilities that truly demand action.

The post Webinar Today: Redefining Vulnerability Management With Exposure Validation appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ThreatSpike Raises $14 Million in Series A Funding
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
ThreatSpike will use the fresh funding to expand its engineering, go-to-market, and security operations teams.

The post ThreatSpike Raises $14 Million in Series A Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Victoria’s Secret Says It Will Postpone Earnings Report After Recent Security Breach
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Victoria’s Secret is postponing the release of its quarterly earnings following a security breach that disrupted the popular lingerie brand’s corporate operations.

The post Victoria’s Secret Says It Will Postpone Earnings Report After Recent Security Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Thousands Hit by The North Face Credential Stuffing Attack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Threat actors steal personal information from thenorthface.com user accounts in a recent credential stuffing campaign.

The post Thousands Hit by The North Face Credential Stuffing Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 35,000 Solar Power Systems Exposed to Internet
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Researchers from Forescout have analyzed the prevalence of internet-exposed solar power devices and shared a list of the top vendors and devices.

The post 35,000 Solar Power Systems Exposed to Internet appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Trustifi Raises $25 Million for AI-Powered Email Security
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Trustifi has raised $25 million in Series A funding to accelerate its product roadmap and go-to-market initiatives.

The post Trustifi Raises $25 Million for AI-Powered Email Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The UK Brings Cyberwarfare Out of the Closet
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
The UK’s 2025 Strategic Defence Review outlines a unified approach to modern warfare, integrating cyber, AI, and electromagnetic capabilities across military domains.

The post The UK Brings Cyberwarfare Out of the Closet appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Mikko Hypponen Leaves Anti-Malware Industry to Fight Against Drones
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Mikko Hypponen has joined the Finnish anti-drone company Sensofusion as Chief Research Officer after three decades of fighting malware.

The post Mikko Hypponen Leaves Anti-Malware Industry to Fight Against Drones appeared first on SecurityWeek.
